newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: STATE'S FOREIGN DEBT $1.119 BILLION IN APRIL.
newsitem.headline: STATE'S FOREIGN DEBT $1.119 BILLION IN APRIL.

text.p: Lithuania's finance ministry said on Friday that the state's foreign debt in hard currency at the end of April 1997 was $1.199 billion.
The ministry also said in a statement the country's foreign debt in the state's name was $876.69 million and state guarantees for foreign loans amounted to $322.62 million.
The ministry also said that the foreign debt amounted to 13.7 percent of the country's gross domestic product (GDP).
The ministry said that the state borrowed $85.72 million and repaid $52.78 million during the first four months of 1997.
It said that the state's total foreign debt rose by $32.94 million during the first four months of the year.
It also said that the calculations were based on the official exchange rate posted by the Bank of Lithuania as of May 1, 1997.
